text:
[error] (22)Invalid argument: setsockopt(SO_RCVBUF): Failed to set 
ProxyReceiveBufferSize, using default

I tried different values, all multiple of 512 but there is always the same 
error message in access log (above)

I can find nowhere what is the max or allowable value for this SO_RCVBUF in 
microsoft docs.

don't know either what is the default.
creator: pascal.barbedor@laposte.net

text:
It could be because Win/2000 doesn't support the setting of the receive buffer
size.

When it says "using default" it means "leaving the value to whatever the OS set
it as". There is no way for Apache to know what the default value is.

Is there a reason why you need to set it?
creator: minfrin@sharp.fm

text:
the reason was being sure big pages (200k+) were passed in one time and not 
sliced.

since the back end server is modperl1 enabled (on nt) it is written in docs 
that a good way to  circumvent the relative inefficiency of modperl on nt is to 
set up a proxy front-end, to pass only modperl specific request to the modperl 
backend, and assure that on way back, modperl server responses are gobble in 
one time by the front end proxy server. hence proxyreceive buffer size.

I am only reading docs and trying things.
creator: pascal.barbedor@laposte.net
minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
The option you are looking for is ProxyIOBufferSize (which seems to be missing
from the v2.0 docs).
